simplified: Your dreams can give you ideas about things you didn't know you were thinking about. Common dreams, like flying, falling, losing your teeth, or being naked in public, usually mean similar things for many people. To understand what they mean for you, think about your daily life and your feelings.

One interesting case of wild animals in a city is the wild dogs of Moscow. There are about 35,000 wild dogs living on the streets of Moscow. Some dogs were born wild, and some were pets that people left behind. Some dogs live alone, and others live in groups. In 2010, scientists studied these dogs and found that they have adapted well to city life. They have learned it is safer to cross the street with people, and some dogs seem to understand traffic lights.

Wonder is the first novel by RJ Palacio, who lives in New York. She got the idea for the book after seeing a girl with a different-looking face on the street. Wonder has sold many copies in the United States and has won several awards. Many schools use it to talk about bullying, friendship, and being different. A movie is being made, and many people, including me, are excited to see what RJ Palacio will write next.

Chloe has two pet rats named Zena and Roxy. She knows they are not usual pets, and she has tried many times to tell people that rats are not dirty and can be great pets if you take care of them. She understands why some people don’t like them. Chloe didn’t like rats at first, but her friend Martin showed her his pet rats, and she saw how loving and smart they are. Last year, when one of Martin's rats had babies, Chloe decided to get two of them.

Cape Town can be a dangerous place for baboons. Some have been hurt or killed in car accidents, and others have died from electric shocks while playing with wires. Baboons are an endangered species. To help them and reduce problems between people and baboons, the city council has hired a team of Baboon Monitors. Their job is to chase baboons away from the city or catch them and release them in the countryside. This plan has worked a little, but it is hard to stop baboons from returning to the city because they find easy food there.

I work for a big IT company, but their main office is in the United States. I do all my work online from home. This way, I don’t spend time traveling or talking with coworkers. I work on different projects, and this is good for me because I can take time off when my kids have school events or when I need to go to the dentist. The bad part is that I don’t have set work hours, so I often work late into the evening and sometimes miss dinner to finish my work.

In the 1990s, graffiti was still popular, but street art became very popular around the world. Some artists wanted to share their ideas about important issues like war, unfairness, and discrimination. Other street artists focused on making beautiful art. In South America, many street artists worked in poor areas, making grey city walls colorful and lively.

Every day, social media, magazines, and store windows show people many things to buy. People in Britain are buying more clothes and shoes than ever. Online shopping makes it easy to buy things without thinking. Big brands sell very cheap clothes, so people often wear them a few times and then throw them away.

Sam squinted at the sun and saw a dust trail from a car going to the Big House. The horses kicked and swatted at flies, not caring that their owner was visiting for the first time in ten months. Sam waited. Mr. Carter only came out here when he had to, and that was fine with Sam. The more he stayed away from his boss, the longer he would keep his job. Mr. Carter wiped sweat from his neck. The wet spots on his shirt looked like shapes on a map. His skin was already getting red in the June sun. He looked like a man who made money while others did the work.

Many people in Berlin, Germany, said that shooting pigs is very cruel. There were strong arguments between hunters and people who love animals. Because of the protests, the city council chose to try a kinder way to deal with the pigs. Instead of shooting them, they built fences and made it illegal to feed the pigs. We will see if this plan works, but it might be hard because warmer winters mean there are more pigs than before.

Suzanne was inspired to write the Hunger Games because she loves Greek myths. When she was a child, she liked the story of Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story, the city of Athens is controlled by Crete, but the people of Athens fight back. As a punishment, the king of Crete, Minos, makes the Athenians send seven boys and seven girls to Crete every year. These young people are put in a maze and eaten by a monster called the Minotaur. But one boy, named Theseus, fights and kills the Minotaur. Suzanne thinks of Katniss Everdeen as a modern Theseus.

Zoos can help people learn about protecting animals and their homes. They bring people and animals together. Some zoos give a safe place for animals that were hurt in circuses or pets that were left behind. Zoos also do important research on how animals behave and how to help them when they are sick.

A new trend is starting against buying too much – the 'buy nothing' trend. It began in Canada in the early 1990s and then spread to the US. It is a way to say no to spending too much on Black Friday and Cyber Monday during Thanksgiving. On Buy Nothing Day, people protest and cut their credit cards. All year, Buy Nothing groups help people exchange and fix things they already have.

Is graffiti art or vandalism? It depends on how you see it. In many countries, writing or painting on public or private property is seen as vandalism. Many street artists have been stopped by the police, and some have had to pay fines. City councils often complain about the high cost of cleaning graffiti from buildings, buses, and trains.

What does the art world think about graffiti and street art? More people are starting to see it as real art. There have been big shows of street art in galleries in Paris, London, and Los Angeles. In 2008, the American artist Elura Emerald organized a street art show in a New York gallery. She supported street artists, saying, "Artists who paint on the street are just expressing themselves and not hurting anyone. They should be appreciated and celebrated."

Most people have four to six dreams every night after they turn ten. This means they can have about 2,000 dreams each year. By the time a person is 80 years old, they might have had around 140,000 dreams. Even if we forget 95–99 percent of our dreams, we still remember a few thousand dreams in our lives. It is easy to think that a dream can happen by chance before something similar happens in real life, especially if the dream is about something we see often.

The Hunger Games is set in the future, after North America is destroyed. The country is called Panem and has twelve poor districts controlled by the rich Capitol. The Capitol has all the power. Each district makes different things for the Capitol. District 12, where the story starts, provides all the coal for the country. There was a thirteenth district, but it fought against the Capitol and was destroyed.

Wild animals often come into cities to find food. In Cape Town, South Africa, baboons have started coming into neighborhoods near the city. They open trash bins and eat fruit from gardens. Some bold baboons have even gone into people's homes and taken food from kitchens! Baboons can be dangerous and have attacked many pets, so many people in the city do not like them.

Many bridge accidents happen while the bridge is being built. These accidents often happen because the engineers make a mistake, like calculating wrong. The bridge can fall down because it is too heavy, and this can be very dangerous for the workers on it.

George Lucas was one of the first film directors to use the 17 stages of the hero's journey in his stories. Usually, the hero begins with a normal life, but then something happens that leads them to an adventure that changes everything. In Star Wars, Luke lives a normal life with his aunt and uncle, fixing robots. When he discovers Princess Leia's message to Obi-Wan Kenobi in the robot R2D2, it is the moment that starts his adventure.

One idea to protect Earth from a dangerous asteroid is to use a nuclear weapon to blow it up. This might sound like a movie story, like the 1998 film Armageddon, but it is a real plan from NASA called the Hypervelocity Asteroid Mitigation Mission for Emergency Response (HAMMER). They would shoot eight-ton rockets at the asteroid to try to change its path. If the asteroid is too close for this to work, the rockets would have nuclear bombs to blow it up.

Campbell says that at first, the hero does not want to go on an adventure. Then, a mentor comes to help them. The hero decides to go into a special world where the adventure takes place. Next, the hero faces tests, fights enemies, and meets friends to get ready for the biggest challenge. For Luke, the mentor is Obi-Wan, his friends are Han Solo and the robots R2D2 and C3PO, and the enemy is Darth Vader in the special world of the Death Star.

Some items that people don’t use much may seem useless, but others might find them helpful. With the internet, online groups have found ways to make money by sharing these items. Websites and social media make it easy to buy and sell second-hand goods. This is called the sharing economy.

In the 18th and 19th centuries, two main ideas about dreams became popular. One idea was that dreams show things we do not know about ourselves. Freud thought that if we understand our dreams, we can learn about our hidden feelings and problems. The other idea was different. It said that dreams are just random thoughts in our brain while it sorts memories and events from the day. When we wake up, we try to understand these random images and feelings and make a story from them.

I am a freelancer and work for myself. This is good because I can choose what I do and how I use my time. At first, I worked from home, but it was hard to focus. There were too many things to distract me, like housework, tea, and my family needing my help. So, I started working in a café, but the Wi-Fi was not good, and I drank too much coffee. Finally, I decided to rent a desk in a co-working space with five other freelancers. I liked getting dressed for work in the morning and being able to focus in an office.

NASA needs money to build a space telescope called NEOCam. This telescope is 0.5 meters wide and will use infrared light to find asteroids. If NASA gets the money, it could find the middle-sized asteroids in about ten years. After finding them, the team will still need to figure out how to protect the Earth from the most dangerous asteroids, called PHAs.

The 'buy nothing' trend is now popular with social media influencers who usually show clothes and make-up for people to buy. Some YouTube stars tell their viewers not to buy anything for up to a year. Two friends in Canada spent a year only buying food. For the first three months, they learned to live without buying electronics, clothes, or home items. Then, they stopped using services like haircuts, eating at restaurants, or buying gas for their cars. In one year, they saved $55,000.

Religion is important to Pi. His family is Hindu, but he is interested in other religions. He becomes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. To everyone's surprise, Pi says he is Hindu, Muslim, and Christian at the same time. When his family and teachers ask him to pick one religion, Pi says, "I just want to love God." After that, his family and teachers let him choose his own beliefs.

Some people believe that writing down your dreams can help you have lucid dreams. Lucid dreams are when you know you are dreaming and can change what happens in the dream. This means you can turn a scary dream into a nice one or control the story of your dream like a movie director. Instead of just understanding your dreams, you can create them. But, you might still want to have some dreams that let your mind share what it is thinking!

Many people do not know they help the problem of disposable clothing when they give their old clothes to charities. But charity shops cannot sell all these clothes. 'Fast fashion' becomes old very quickly and is often too low quality to recycle; people do not want to buy it used. A lot of clothes are thrown away, and many that charities cannot sell are sent to other countries, which creates more problems for the economy and the environment.

Some adventurers want more than one great trip. Meagan McGrath from Canada has climbed the highest mountains in every continent, biked across Canada, and run a long race in the hot Sahara Desert. But her most amazing trip was skiing to the South Pole. On the first day, she fell into a glacier and needed help. Many people would have stopped there, but Meagan kept going. After forty days, she reached the South Pole, pulling a sled with her tent and food through very cold weather and ice storms.

Blek le Rat began by painting rats on the walls in Paris, his home city. Now, he wants people to think about social issues. He paints pictures of homeless people in big cities to make people think about homelessness.

In some places, local governments want artists to stop painting graffiti on random walls. They let them paint in special areas. Taiwan has 'graffiti zones' where artists can paint and write freely. In São Paulo, Brazil, the city has allowed some graffiti artists to paint on subway trains.

Faith47 is from Cape Town, South Africa. She paints large, colorful pictures of people and animals. She enjoys exploring different places. You can find her art on sidewalks, in empty factories, and on old cars. She likes that most street art does not last long and will be washed away by rain or cleaned up by city workers. For her, this shows that life is always changing with new starts and endings.

In her last job, Gabriela worked in a culture where people respected power and authority. In this culture, leaders made the big decisions and were not often questioned. However, her Swedish team was used to a different culture where employees worked together with their bosses to solve problems and make decisions. In this culture, leaders acted like coaches who encouraged people to think for themselves and welcomed questions.

When Gabriela noticed the cultural differences with her team, she decided to talk to them about how they felt about her leadership. Her team was happy to share their thoughts. They said they were not used to being told what to do and liked having more freedom to be creative. When Gabriela told them exactly what to do, they felt she did not trust them to do their jobs well. They understood that Gabriela took it personally when they tried to suggest changes, and they explained that this was how they had always worked.

Os Gêmeos are identical twin brothers from São Paulo. They paint many things, from small tags to big, colorful pictures of people on buildings. Their art is often very large, so they use cranes to help them. In 2007, they painted an entire castle in Scotland.

People have painted and written on walls for a long time. In ancient times, people in Africa and Europe painted pictures of animals and people in caves. Graffiti has been found on old buildings in Greece, Italy, Syria, and Iraq. In the Roman town of Pompeii, archaeologists found many examples of graffiti written in Latin. These include messages about religion, politics, love, and even some magic spells!

Have you ever dreamed of climbing Mount Everest or walking to the South Pole? If yes, you are not alone. Every year, many people try to climb the highest mountains or walk across countries. Unlike explorers in the past who used maps and compasses, today’s adventurers use modern tools like GPS and satellite phones. Many of them love nature and want to help raise awareness about environmental problems. Others want to help people in need and raise money for charities.

The first test is called DART, which stands for Double Asteroid Redirection Test. They plan to test DART on a moon of an asteroid named Didymos. This moon, called 'Didymoon', is 150 meters wide and goes around its bigger asteroid, which is 800 meters wide. They hope that when DART hits Didymoon, it will change its path enough for telescopes on Earth to see it.

The main character of the story is a sixteen-year-old girl named Katniss Everdeen. She lost her father in a mining accident and needs to find food for her family. She hunts in the woods near District 12 with her friend Gale and becomes very good with a bow and arrow. When her younger sister, Prim, is picked to go to the games, Katniss volunteers to take her place. The other person from District 12 is a boy named Peeta, and Katniss starts to have a complicated relationship with him.

Writing about your dreams will help you remember more details. Think about the people and places in your dreams because they can add meaning. After a week, you will be surprised by how much you have written. You can now connect your dreams to what happens and how you feel in your daily life.

In the past, many bridges were made of wood and could easily catch fire. This was especially true for old train bridges. The sparks from the steel wheels and tracks could sometimes make the bridge catch fire and burn down.

We cannot know how street art will change in the future, but we see some trends. Most street artists are young and paint in their own cities, but now many are traveling and working in different countries. Some artists use the internet to connect and share pictures of their art. The art world is also starting to accept street art as real art. We may not know what will happen next, but we can be sure that street art is not going away!

Suzanne Collines has always felt sad when she watched news about wars. When she was a child, her father was a pilot in the US Air Force and he fought in Vietnam. Her mother tried to keep her safe by not telling her about the war, but Suzanne still saw news about it and knew her dad was there. This was very scary for her.

A global survey by PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) asked over 40,000 young people (born between 1983 and 1993) and others about work culture, communication, pay, career growth, and work-life balance. Another survey by Deloitte included over 10,000 young people who shared their views on the challenges and chances in today's work environment.

Erik Weihenmayer is from the United States and loves adventures. He has ridden a bike in the deserts of Morocco, kayaked in the Grand Canyon, and climbed Mount Everest. Erik has been blind since he was 13 years old. He also helps people with disabilities to be active and takes groups of young blind people climbing.

Online platforms are giving people a chance to make some extra money. For example, busy parents used to not sell their children's old things at local markets. Now, with online marketplaces, they can sell baby clothes that their kids have outgrown and expensive baby items. This helps them earn some money back.

Pi and Richard Parker stay in the lifeboat for 227 days. They face hunger, sickness, and tiredness. They go through strong storms and the hot sun, but they survive. Sometimes, Pi feels better because of his three religions, but other times he feels very lonely and sad. Finally, they see the Mexican coast, and everything changes. I won't tell you the ending, so you need to read the book to find out what happens to Pi and Richard Parker when they see land.

Chloe came home from school, made a cup of coffee, and took it to her bedroom. She had homework, but she wanted to wait to do it. She liked to enjoy the quiet time before her parents came home. When they were home, the house became noisy with talking, the TV, or her dad listening to jazz while cooking dinner. She also liked this time because she could play with her pet rats.

In 2010, NASA's planetary defence team found and recorded 90 percent of the asteroids near Earth that are 1 km wide. These are called 'near-Earth objects' or NEOs, and they are the size of mountains. They include anything within 50 million kilometers of Earth's path. NASA thinks there are about 50 more to find, but none of the 887 they know about are a big danger to our planet.

Auggie decides to go to school, but he is very nervous on his first day. Like every child starting a new school, he feels anxious. Because of his appearance, it is even harder for him. Other kids do not want to sit with him, and he sees them staring or whispering about him. Luckily, he makes friends with Jack, a boy in his class, and Summer, a girl he talks to at lunch. But the first day is not the only hard part. Auggie finds out that his classmates do not want to touch him because they are scared of getting sick. As the school year goes on, Auggie has many ups and downs, and then a surprising and difficult event at a school camp changes everything.

The two men looked at the northern side of the land. It went on and on, and they could hardly see the fences. A teenage boy might feel bored and want to escape, but he couldn't run away on foot. Sam looked at the biggest horse, which was kicking the ground. He wondered if the boy could ride. A good rider could find a lot of trouble out here, far from anyone. But someone who didn't know about horses and wanted to leave his father could get into even more trouble.

More than 4,000 climbers, aged from thirteen to eighty, have reached the top of Everest. Climbing high mountains in cold weather and strong storms is very dangerous, but the best climbers want new challenges. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner from Austria loved mountain climbing when she was a teenager. After school, she worked as a nurse but continued to climb in her free time.

After climbing Everest, Gerlinde wanted to climb all fourteen mountains that are 8,000 meters high. To make it harder, she climbs without oxygen tanks. This is dangerous because there is less oxygen at the top of high mountains, which can affect how the brain and body work. Gerlinde uses her fame as a climber to help a charity for poor children and orphans in Nepal.

If we look at the things we have bought in our lives, we can see that not everything is used well. For example, we might have a thick wool coat that we thought was stylish, even though we live in a hot country. We may have a smartphone that we stopped using when we got a new one. We might have a car that we only use on weekends, or a guest room in our house that has become a storage room.

Throughout history and in different cultures, people have believed that dreams can predict the future. They thought dreams were messages from gods that gave us important information. Even now, many people remember a dream about something that later happened in real life.

Some of the biggest and most costly transportation projects in the world are bridges. Bridges are important because they help cars, trucks, and trains cross rivers, deep valleys, or other roads. They are a key part of civil engineering and are closely watched, especially if they fall down.

After weeks of feeling frustrated, Gabriela sent an email to her Swedish manager about the problems she had with her team. Her manager asked her if she thought her team was still doing well and what could help her work better with them. Gabriela thought her manager was not clear and did not feel he was handling the situation well.

Dogs that live in groups have learned that people often give food to smaller, cuter dogs. So, these dogs go to ask for food for the whole group. Some dogs can even use the metro to move around the city! Scientists are not sure how they know when to get off the train. One idea is that they use their strong sense of smell to find their favorite places. Another idea is that they recognize the names of stations from the announcements. Now, people on the metro are so used to seeing dogs that they often don’t notice them.

Ed Stafford from the UK is the first person to walk the whole Amazon River. He began at a small stream in the Andes mountains in Peru and reached the river's end in Brazil after two years and four months. He walked 6,000 kilometers. The Amazon rainforest has dangerous animals like poisonous snakes, crocodiles, and jaguars, so Ed was always in danger. Luckily, he only got a lot of mosquito and ant bites.

In Britain, the average person spends over £1,000 on new clothes each year. This is about four percent of their income. This may not seem like a lot, but it shows two big problems for society and the environment. First, many people use credit cards to pay for clothes. Right now, British adults owe about £670 each to credit card companies. This is 66 percent of what they spend on clothes. Also, people are buying things they do not need and spending money they do not have. Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothes every year, and most of it goes to landfills.

Ed's walk was only possible because of technology. He used a radio to ask the people in the rainforest for food and to cross their land. Many people came to help him and showed him the best paths. While he walked, Ed wrote a blog about his daily experiences. He used the attention from the media to talk about the damage to the rainforest and to raise money for charities that help the environment and children in Brazil and Peru.

Businesses have noticed that the sharing economy can make money, so they want to use resources that are not being used much. A popular business model now is where companies create online platforms to connect customers with people who offer a product or service. For example, Airbnb helps people rent out their empty rooms and houses for extra money. Another example is Uber, which lets people use their own cars as taxis to earn some extra cash in their free time.

One important job of zoos today is to help breed endangered animals. In the wild, some rare animals have trouble finding partners to mate with. They also face dangers from hunters, losing their homes, and other animals that hunt them. A good zoo helps these animals live and breed safely. As some wild animal numbers go down, they can become too similar genetically. Breeding programs help by allowing zoo-bred animals to be released into the wild, which increases genetic diversity.

Both types of accidents are very rare, but boats and trains can make a bridge fall for different reasons. Trains can cause a bridge to fall because they hit it very hard. Boats can make a bridge fall because they are very heavy, even if they are moving slowly. The best way to stop bridges from falling is to plan ahead. New technology can find weak spots, safer work areas, and better designs can all help to prevent these bad accidents.

At first, Pi is very scared of the animals and jumps into the ocean. Then he remembers there are hungry sharks in the water and knows he must climb back into the lifeboat. One by one, the animals in the lifeboat kill and eat each other, until only Pi and a tiger are left. Luckily for Pi, the tiger, which he names Richard Parker, is feeling sick and does not want to eat him right now.

When Pi is 16, a new government is elected that his parents do not like. They are worried about the future, so they decide to close the zoo and move to Canada. Some animals are sold to zoos in North America, and the family travels by ship to Canada with the animals. During the trip, there is a big storm and the ship sinks. Sadly, Pi's family and the sailors drown, but Pi is in a lifeboat with a hyena, a zebra, an orangutan, and a big tiger.

The Hunger Games is a very popular book for teenagers and young adults. It was written by American author Suzanne Collins and published in 2008. The book has been translated into 26 languages and has sold millions of copies worldwide. It was also the first book for young readers to sell over a million electronic copies. The Hunger Games is now a big movie in Hollywood and is very successful. It made 152.5 million dollars in its first weekend in North America!

Dreams might happen because our mind is sorting out our thoughts from the day. These thoughts show up in dreams with special meanings. When we are awake, we think mostly in words, like talking to ourselves. But when we sleep, the part of our brain that helps us use words is less active, and the part that deals with feelings is more active.

Having good relationships is very important for happiness. In a study, most happy people had strong connections with friends and family and spent time with them often. You also need at least one person to share your feelings with. This is called 'self-disclosure'. Just one close friend is enough, along with other friends. It’s not enough to have many friends just to hang out or talk about music or football. A deeper connection is very important. Some people need to learn how to listen better to build stronger relationships.

Psychologist Carol Dweck talks about how our brains can change and how we can learn new skills. Many people often praise others for their natural talents, like saying, "You are good at noticing details" or "You are great at organizing events." But studies show that if we focus on how people do things—like their effort, trying new ideas, and solving problems—we can help them learn new skills and improve their talents.

The rover checks the air around it from time to time. In 2014, it found a simple organic molecule called methane, which is also a part of natural gas. Methane does not last long, only a few hundred years. This means something on Mars is making more methane. NASA says Mars releases thousands of tons of methane at once. The amount of methane goes up and down with the seasons, like the planet is breathing.

Early in her career, psychologist Carol Dweck from Stanford University gave ten-year-olds some hard problems. One group liked the challenge and believed they could get better. She called this a 'growth mindset.' They thought about what they could achieve in the future. 

The other group felt judged and thought they had failed. They had a 'fixed mindset' and could not see how to improve. Some of these children said they might cheat later, while others looked for someone who did worse than them to feel better about themselves.

Horror films like empty places. This can be an old hospital, a scary house, or a ghost town. Empty places make us think about what life was like when people lived there. Why did they go away? These places are very quiet, which can be scary. Also, they are good for horror films because there is usually no phone signal there.

The basement is a scary place in horror films, no matter what kind of house it is. It is often dark and wet. You can only get to it by a narrow staircase. Basements feel creepy, even if there is nothing there.

Gary Collins, a policeman on holiday, was watching the London riots on TV. He saw some people he knew and decided to cut his holiday short to help. He spent six months looking at CCTV videos and identified 190 people, often just by their eyes. His help was very important for the investigation. Even with 200,000 hours of video, the facial recognition software found only one person.

I find it very interesting to think about how we can make our bodies better. Imagine if we could put a computer in our brain! Soon, we will be able to do this and improve our math skills, how we see and hear, and our memory. This idea will become more normal in the future.

It was an interesting talk, and the speaker made some good points. For example, she talked about how parents influence their kids. How can we expect teenagers not to text while doing homework if they see their parents using social media while cooking or waiting at a red light? She also mentioned how people want to be in many places at once. They often switch between talking in real life and online. I see this a lot with my teenage daughter and her friends. They meet up but sit quietly, each talking to someone else online.

There are news stories that make us think the world is more violent, but there is also some good news. From the end of World War II to 1990, there were 30 wars that killed over 100,000 people. Today, there are still civil wars, but most countries are living together more peacefully than before. However, terrorism has increased in the last few years, and since World War II, more civilians have died in wars than soldiers. Still, not all the news is bad for civilians. Even though violent crime is nine times more likely to cause death than political conflict, the global murder rate went down a little, from 8 per 100,000 people in 2000 to about 5.3 in 2015.

Wasfia has spent her life helping human rights. She has seen many projects in her country that teach women and girls, but often these projects end, and the women are left with nothing. Wasfia realized that Bangladesh needed to be stronger, so she combined her love for climbing mountains and her work for human rights to change how people think about women in her country. She started climbing while helping in Tibet and Nepal because most people in flat Bangladesh have never seen a mountain. Her campaign is working, and more people in Bangladesh and around the world are paying attention.

Many people think that developing countries are in a very bad place. They see a lot of poverty, bad leaders, and no hope for change. But this is not true. In fact, big changes are happening. In the last 20 years, more than 700 million people have earned more money and left poverty. Also, six million fewer children die from sickness each year, more girls are going to school, and many more people have clean water.

Many managers try to make their feedback more positive by putting negative comments between two positive ones. But if they do this all the time, workers may think the positive comments are just hiding the negative ones, which makes them less valuable. Positive feedback should not just cover up the negative; it should help to support and encourage good work.

I am part of the Campaign to Stop Killer Robots. Forget the scary robots from movies. Right now, military machines like drones and robots are already used to kill with little help from people. The next step is robots that can decide who to kill by themselves. I believe this is very wrong and dangerous for people. We need to be careful about what we let machines do.

More people are learning English than any other language, and English is spoken in the most countries. However, Chinese has the most native speakers. There is not much connection between the number of native speakers and the number of learners. But there is a stronger connection between the number of learners and how many countries speak the language.

Your manager stops you and says she wants to talk about your work on the recent project. You feel worried all weekend, thinking about what you might have done wrong. When you go into her office on Monday morning, she starts by saying good things about your work on the project. You think maybe this is just the usual way to give feedback. You know the feedback sandwich: first say something nice, then say what you really want to say, and finally say something nice again.

Born in the USA is a fast and exciting rock album. The songs are fun to listen to, but they also tell important stories. Many songs talk about the hard lives of regular people and their feelings of sadness and anger when they do not get rich or famous. For example, the song Glory Days is about people in a small town remembering their youth when they felt strong and free. Downbound Train tells the story of a young man whose life falls apart after he loses his job. The artist seems to share real stories from people he knows and what his life could have been if he wasn't a star. This album shows the amazing talent of the artist, known as the Boss.

Lewis wants to increase the number of marine protected areas in the world from 3 percent to 10 percent. He believes this can help fix the damage caused by human activities like overfishing, pollution, and littering. Lewis has seen this damage himself. He has swum over coral reefs that are dying because the water is too warm and has seen empty areas under the Red Sea filled with plastic. Pugh thinks nature can heal if we give it space, but time is running out. If we do not take care of our seas, we may face a big problem soon.

Terrie Sharp is a best-selling author who tells great stories. She has won the Olive Crime Writer Award two times. She grew up in a place in Glasgow with a lot of crime. There, she learned to be quiet, avoid trouble, and how to open car doors with a knife. Fortunately, she only used these skills for her books. Now, she is not so quiet and appears on popular daytime shows like Police Today and at writing events across the UK.

Are things getting worse every day? Is it impossible to make progress? In "Enlightenment Now," Steven Pinker talks about human progress and shares good news. We are living longer, healthier, and happier lives. Pinker believes the real problem is that the values of reason and science are being attacked. When people focus on their groups, fear, and distrust, we risk harming important things like democracy and working together in the world.

In old horror movies, when the main characters were in trouble, it was hard for them to get help or call the police. Now, with mobile phones, this seems less real. So, how do they keep the suspense? They make sure there is no phone signal! If you are a hero in a horror movie, it is very likely that when you really need to call for help, you will have no signal. Or your phone battery will die right when you try to call. Or both will happen.

In the 1950s, banana farmers in Central America were losing their best product, the Gros Michel banana, also called Big Mike. Now, the same thing is happening to the Cavendish banana, which is the main type grown today. The Gros Michel banana was popular because it was sweet, had a thick skin, and was easy to transport. United Fruit, the biggest banana company in South America at that time, made a lot of bananas by cloning parts of the plants instead of using seeds. They grew them in crowded fields.

Most spiders have venom to stun or kill their prey, not to attack humans. Only 25 types of spiders can harm people. Spider bites can hurt, but they usually are not deadly. The Sydney funnel-web spider in Australia has not killed anyone since doctors made an anti-venom in 1981. Be careful with hairy spiders like tarantulas. If they feel scared, they can release irritating hairs that can get stuck in your skin or eyes.

This scary movie idea was very popular in horror films from the late 1900s. It starts with a group of teenagers having fun, and it ends with everyone dead except one girl. At the start, the girl is usually innocent, shy, and not very strong. By the end, she becomes the strongest and smartest person. The last girl almost always wins.

To understand where our ability to use complex language comes from, we need to look at how our brains are different from other animals. It is not just about brain size; we also need to think about what our brains can do and why they changed over time. There are not many physical clues to help us. The things left by our ancestors do not show us what kind of speech they could make. However, we can see changes in the mouth, throat, and tongue of early humans. About 100,000 years ago, humans could make complex sounds. Before that, scientists can only guess if early humans used simpler sounds to communicate.

Society, not nature, tells us that girls should like arts and humanities, while boys should do maths and physics. Many young people do not see positive female role models in science jobs. Cartoons and stories often show scientists, inventors, and astronauts as men. There is also a wrong idea that scientists are strange, have bad social skills, or work alone. These stereotypes from the media can make girls feel that science is not for them. If girls saw more positive female role models in science, it would help them feel more confident and included in those subjects.

The Scallion is a weekly newspaper that is free for students and is found in faculty buildings. About 10,000 students read it. Students write and make the newspaper. A survey shows that university students and staff like it for fun, culture, and work experience. Printing the newspaper costs a lot of money. Some students cannot easily get a copy because they have to go to the university to find it. Also, many copies become litter on campus, which is bad for the environment.

At Girox Foods, about 12 out of every 100 employees leave each year. This number seems high because the usual rate in the industry is 7 out of 100. This report aims to find out why employees feel engaged at work and to give suggestions to make their experience better and keep them working here longer.

What the speaker said felt very true. I really believe that the more connected we are, the more alone we can feel. This is not a big problem for my generation because we lived without technology for a long time. We know how to be alone and that it is OK to be alone. But for people under 20, it is different. They are always talking online and may never feel alone. They might not learn how to enjoy being by themselves. Also, they are learning to talk through messages that can be changed, instead of having real conversations with people face to face.
Don't always give negative feedback after positive feedback. If you always mix them, people may not value the positive comments. Sometimes, just give positive feedback without adding any criticism.

Your dreams can give you new ideas about things you didn't know you were thinking about. Common dreams, like flying, falling, losing your teeth, or being naked in public, usually have similar meanings for many people. However, to understand what they mean for you, it's important to link them to your daily life events and feelings.

One of the most interesting examples of wild animals in a city is the wild dogs of Moscow. There are about 35,000 wild dogs living on the streets of Moscow. Some of these dogs were born wild, while others were pets that their owners left behind. Some dogs live alone, and others live in groups. In 2010, scientists studied these dogs and found that they have adapted very well to city life. They have learned that it is safer to cross the street with people, and some dogs seem to understand traffic lights.

Wonder is RJ Palacio's first novel. She says on her website that the idea for the book came to her after she saw a girl with facial differences on the street. Wonder has been very popular in the United States and has won many awards. Many schools use it to talk about bullying, friendship, and being different. A movie is being made, and many people, including me, are excited to see what RJ Palacio will write next.

Chloe has two pet rats named Zena and Roxy. She knows they are not common pets, and she has tried many times to explain to people that rats are not dirty and can be great pets if cared for properly. She understands why some people have a negative reaction. Chloe also didn't like rats at first until her friend Martin showed her his pet rats, and she saw how loving and smart they are. Last year, when one of Martin's rats had babies, Chloe decided she wanted to have two of them.

Cape Town can be a dangerous place for baboons. Some have been hurt or killed in car accidents, and others have been electrocuted while playing with electric wires. Baboons are an endangered species, so to protect them and reduce problems between people and baboons, the city council has hired a team of Baboon Monitors. Their job is to chase baboons out of the city or catch them and release them in the countryside. This plan has worked somewhat, but it is difficult to stop baboons from returning to the city when they find easy food there.

I work for a global IT company, but their main office is in the United States, so I do all my work online from home. This way, I don’t waste time traveling or chatting with coworkers. I work on different projects, and this flexibility is important to me because I can take time off when my children have school events or if I need to go to the dentist. The downside is that without set office hours, I often work late into the evening and sometimes skip dinner to finish my work.

In the 1990s, graffiti was still popular, but street art became very popular around the world. Some artists used their art to share political messages and make people think about issues like war, inequality, and discrimination. Other street artists focused on creating beautiful and attractive pieces. In South America, many street artists worked in poor neighborhoods, bringing color, life, and beauty to dull city walls.

Every day, social media, magazines, and store windows show people many things to buy. British shoppers are buying more clothes and shoes than ever. Online shopping makes it easy to buy things without thinking. Big brands sell very cheap clothes, so people often wear them a few times and then throw them away.

Sam squinted at the sun and saw a dust trail from a car driving to the Big House. The horses kicked and swatted at flies, not caring that their owner was visiting for the first time in ten months. Sam waited. Mr. Carter only came out here when he had to, which was good for Sam. The more he stayed out of his boss's way, the longer he would keep his job. Mr. Carter wiped sweat from his neck. The wet spots on his shirt looked like shapes on a map. His skin was already getting red in the June sun. He had the tan of a man who made money while others did the work.

Many people in Berlin, Germany, complained that shooting pigs was too cruel. This caused strong arguments between hunters and animal lovers. In response to the protests, the city council decided to take a kinder approach. Instead of shooting the pigs, they built fences and made it illegal to feed them. We will see if this plan works, but it might be hard because warmer winters mean there are more pigs than before.

An important inspiration for the Hunger Games book comes from Suzanne's love of Greek mythology. When she was a child, one of her favorite stories was about Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story, the city of Athens is controlled by Crete, but the people of Athens fight back. As a punishment, King Minos of Crete makes the Athenians send seven boys and seven girls to Crete every year. These young people are put into a maze and eaten by a monster called the Minotaur. But one of the boys, named Theseus, fights the Minotaur and kills it. Suzanne sees Katniss Everdeen as a modern version of Theseus.

Zoos can help teach people about protecting animals and their homes by bringing them together. Some zoos give a safe place to animals that were hurt in circuses or pets that were left behind. They also do important research on how animals behave and how to help them when they are sick.

A new trend is growing against consumerism called the 'buy nothing' trend. It started in Canada in the early 1990s and then spread to the US. This trend is a way to say no to spending too much money on Black Friday and Cyber Monday during Thanksgiving weekend. On Buy Nothing Day, people hold protests and cut up their credit cards. Throughout the year, Buy Nothing groups help people exchange and repair items they already have.

Is graffiti art or vandalism? It depends on how you see it. In many countries, writing or painting on public or private property is seen as vandalism. Many street artists have been stopped by the police, and some have had to pay fines. City councils often complain about the high cost of cleaning graffiti from buildings, buses, and trains.

What does the art world think about graffiti and street art? Recently, more people are starting to see it as a real art form. There have been big exhibitions of street art in galleries in Paris, London, and Los Angeles. In 2008, the American artist Elura Emerald organized a street art exhibition in a New York gallery. She supported street artists, saying, "Artists who paint on the street are just expressing themselves and not hurting anyone. They should be appreciated and celebrated."

Most people have four to six dreams every night after they turn ten. This means they can have about 2,000 dreams each year. By the time a person is 80 years old, they might have had around 140,000 dreams. Even if we forget 95–99 percent of our dreams, we still remember a few thousand dreams in our lives. It’s easy to think that a dream might match something that happens in real life, especially if the dream is about something common in daily life.

The Hunger Games is set in the future, after North America has been destroyed. The country is called Panem and has twelve poor districts controlled by the rich Capitol. The Capitol has complete power over the country. Each district makes different products for the Capitol. District 12, where the story starts, provides all the coal for Panem. There used to be a thirteenth district, but it rebelled against the Capitol and was destroyed.

Wild animals often enter cities to find food. In Cape Town, South Africa, baboons have begun to come into neighborhoods near the city. They open trash bins and eat fruit from gardens and farms. Some bold baboons have even gone into people's homes and taken food from kitchens! Baboons can be dangerous and have attacked many pets, so many people in the city do not like having them around.

Many bridge accidents happen while the bridge is being built. These accidents often happen because of mistakes by the engineers, like wrong calculations. The bridge can fall down because it is too heavy, which can be very dangerous for the workers on it.

George Lucas was one of the first film directors to use the 17 stages of the hero's journey in his stories. Usually, the hero begins with a normal life, but then something happens that leads them to an adventure that changes everything. In Star Wars, Luke starts with a simple life with his aunt and uncle, fixing robots. When he discovers Princess Leia's message to Obi-Wan Kenobi in the robot R2D2, it is the moment that calls him to adventure and starts his journey.

One idea to protect Earth from a dangerous asteroid is to use a nuclear weapon to blow it up. This might sound like a movie story, like in the 1998 film Armageddon, but it is a real plan from NASA called the Hypervelocity Asteroid Mitigation Mission for Emergency Response (HAMMER). The plan involves launching eight-ton rockets at an asteroid to try to change its path. If the asteroid is too close for this to work, the rockets would have nuclear bombs to destroy it instead.

Campbell says that the hero usually does not want to start their adventure at first. Then, a mentor comes to help them, and they choose to enter a new world where the adventure takes place. Next, the hero faces challenges, fights enemies, and meets friends as they get ready for their biggest test. For Luke, his mentor is Obi-Wan, his friends are Han Solo and the robots R2D2 and C3PO, and his enemy is Darth Vader in the special world of the Death Star.

Items that are not used much might seem useless to some people, but they can be valuable to others. With the rise of the internet, online communities have found ways to make money by sharing these underused items. Websites and social media groups that help people buy and sell second-hand goods make it easier for people to share with each other. This is called the sharing economy.

In the 18th and 19th centuries, two main ideas about dreams became popular. One idea was that dreams show things we do not know about ourselves. Freud thought that if we understand our dreams, we can learn about our hidden feelings and the problems they cause. The other idea was different. It said that dreams are just random activity in the brain while it organizes memories and events from the day. When we wake up, we try to make sense of these random images and feelings and create a story from them.

I am a freelancer, which means I work for myself. This is great because I can choose what I do and how I use my time. At first, I worked from home, but it was hard to focus. There were too many distractions, like housework, making tea, and family members needing my help. So, I started working at a café, but the Wi-Fi was not good, and I ended up drinking too much coffee. Finally, I decided to rent a desk in a co-working space with five other freelancers. I enjoyed getting dressed for work in the morning and being able to concentrate in an office.

NASA's ability to find the remaining middle-sized near-Earth objects (NEOs) depends on getting funding to build NEOCam, a 0.5-meter space telescope that will use infrared light to find asteroids. If they receive the money, they could reach their goal in ten years. After finding these asteroids, the planetary defense team will still need to figure out how to protect the Earth from the most dangerous asteroids, known as PHAs.

The 'buy nothing' trend is now popular among social media influencers who usually post about clothes and make-up they suggest people buy. Some YouTube stars are now telling their viewers not to buy anything for up to a year. Two friends in Canada spent a year trying to buy only food. In the first three months, they learned to live without buying electronics, clothes, or home items. In the next part, they stopped using services like haircuts, eating at restaurants, or buying gas for their cars. By the end of the year, they saved $55,000.

Religion is important to Pi. His family is Hindu, but he is interested in other religions too. He becomes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. To everyone's surprise, Pi says he wants to be Hindu, Muslim, and Christian at the same time. When his family and teachers ask him to pick one religion, Pi says, "I just want to love God." After that, his family and teachers allow him to decide for himself about religion.

Some people believe that writing down your dreams can help you have lucid dreams. Lucid dreams are when you know you are dreaming and can control what happens in the dream. This means you could change a scary dream into a nice one or guide the story of your dream like a movie director. Instead of just figuring out what your dreams mean, you can create them. However, you might still want to have some dreams that let your mind share what it is thinking!

Many people do not know they are part of the problem with disposable clothing because they give their unwanted clothes to charities. However, charity shops cannot sell all these clothes. 'Fast fashion' becomes out of style very quickly and is often too low quality to recycle; people do not want to buy it used. A lot of clothes are thrown away, and many that charities cannot sell are sent to other countries, creating more economic and environmental issues.

Some adventurers are not satisfied with just one great trip; they keep looking for new challenges. Meagan McGrath from Canada has climbed the highest mountains on every continent, biked across Canada, and run a long race in the Sahara Desert in 45ºC heat. But her most amazing journey was skiing to the South Pole. On the first day, she fell into a glacier and needed to be rescued. Many people would have given up then, but Meagan chose to continue. After forty days, she reached the South Pole, pulling a sled with a tent and all her food through freezing weather and ice storms.

Blek le Rat began by painting rats on the walls of his hometown, Paris. Now, he wants people to think about social issues and problems. He paints pictures of homeless people in big cities to make residents think about homelessness.

In some places, local governments have tried to stop artists from painting graffiti on random walls by giving them special areas to work in. Taiwan is one of these places, where there are 'graffiti zones' where artists can paint and write freely. In São Paulo, Brazil, the city council has even let some graffiti artists paint on subway trains.

Faith47 is from Cape Town, South Africa. She paints large, colorful pictures of people and animals and enjoys exploring different places. You can find her art on sidewalks, in empty factories, and on old cars. She likes that most street art does not last long and will soon be washed away by rain or cleaned up by city workers. For her, this shows that life is always changing, with endings and new beginnings.

In her last job, Gabriela worked in a culture where people respected power and authority, and everyone had a specific role. In this culture, leaders made important decisions and were rarely questioned. However, her Swedish team was used to a different culture where employees often worked with their bosses to solve problems and make decisions. In this environment, leaders acted like coaches or mentors, encouraging independent thinking and welcoming challenges.

When Gabriela noticed the cultural differences between her and her team, she decided to talk openly with them about how they felt about her leadership. Her team was happy to share their thoughts. They said they were not used to being told what to do and preferred having more freedom to take initiative and be creative. When Gabriela told them exactly what to do, they felt she did not trust them to do their jobs well. They understood that Gabriela took it personally when they tried to question or change her decisions, and they explained that this was how they had always worked.

Os Gêmeos are identical twin brothers from São Paulo. They paint many things, from small tags to large, colorful pictures of people on buildings. Their art is often so big that they need cranes to help them. In 2007, they painted an entire castle in Scotland.

Throughout history, people have painted and written on walls. In prehistoric times, people in Africa and Europe painted pictures of animals and people in caves. Graffiti has been discovered on buildings in ancient places like Greece, Italy, Syria, and Iraq. In the Roman town of Pompeii, archaeologists found many examples of graffiti written in Latin. These include messages about religion, politics, love, and even some magic spells!

Have you ever dreamed of climbing Mount Everest or walking to the South Pole? If yes, you are not alone. Every year, thousands of people try to climb the highest mountains or walk across continents. Unlike explorers in the past who used maps and compasses, today’s adventurers use modern technology like GPS and satellite phones. Many adventurers love nature and use their trips to raise awareness about environmental issues, while others want to help people in need and raise money for charities.

The first test is called DART, which stands for Double Asteroid Redirection Test. They plan to test DART on a moon of an asteroid named Didymos. This moon, called 'Didymoon,' is 150 meters wide and orbits its larger asteroid, which is 800 meters wide. The goal is for DART to hit Didymoon and change its orbit so that telescopes on Earth can see it.

The main character of the story is a sixteen-year-old girl named Katniss Everdeen. She has lost her father in a mining accident and needs to find food for her family. She hunts in the woods near District 12 with her friend Gale and becomes very good with a bow and arrow. When her younger sister, Prim, is picked as one of the tributes, Katniss decides to go in her place. The other tribute from District 12 is a boy named Peeta, and Katniss soon has a complicated relationship with him.

Writing about your dreams will help you remember more details. Think about the people and places in your dreams, as they can add to their meaning. After a week, you might be surprised by how much you have written. You can then start to link your dreams to what happens and how you feel in your daily life.

In the past, many bridges were made of wood, which could easily catch fire. This was especially true for old train bridges, where sparks from the steel wheels and tracks could start a fire and burn the bridge down.

We cannot predict how street art will change in the future, but we can see some trends. Most street artists are young people who create art in their cities or neighborhoods. However, more artists are now traveling and working in different countries. Many artists also use the internet to communicate and share pictures of their work. The art world is starting to recognize street art as a real form of art. Even though we don't know what will happen next, we can be sure that street art is not going away!

Suzanne Collines has always found news about wars upsetting. When she was a child, her father was a pilot in the US Air Force and fought in Vietnam. Her mother tried to protect her by not talking about the war, but Suzanne still saw news reports and knew her dad was there. This was a very scary experience for her.

In a global survey by PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC), over 40,000 people, both millennials (born between 1983 and 1993) and non-millennials, shared their views on workplace culture, communication, pay, career growth, and work-life balance. In another global survey by Deloitte, more than 10,000 millennials took part in a study about their thoughts on the challenges and chances in today's work environment.

Erik Weihenmayer from the United States is an adventurer. He has ridden a bike in the deserts of Morocco, kayaked in the Grand Canyon, and climbed Mount Everest. Remarkably, Erik has been blind since he was 13 years old. Besides his adventures, he encourages people with disabilities to be active and takes groups of young blind people on climbing trips.

Online platforms are giving people a chance to make some extra money. For example, busy parents used to avoid selling their children's old things at local markets or car boot sales. Now, with online marketplaces, they can easily sell baby clothes that their children have outgrown and expensive baby gear they bought, helping them earn some cash.

Pi and Richard Parker stay in the lifeboat for 227 days. They face hunger, sickness, and tiredness. They go through strong storms and the hot sun of the Pacific, but they manage to survive. Sometimes, Pi feels comfort from his three religions, but other times he feels very lonely and sad. Finally, they see the Mexican coast in the distance, and everything changes. I won’t tell you the ending, so you need to read the book to find out what happens to Pi and Richard Parker when they see land.

Chloe got home from school, made a cup of coffee, and took it to her bedroom. She had homework to do, but she decided to do it later. She wanted to enjoy the quiet time before her parents came home and the house became noisy with talking, the TV, or her dad listening to jazz while cooking dinner. She also liked this time because she could play with her pet rats.

In 2010, NASA's planetary defense team found and recorded 90 percent of the asteroids near Earth that are 1 km wide. These are called 'near-Earth objects' or NEOs, and they are the size of mountains. They include anything within 50 million kilometers of Earth's orbit. NASA estimates there are about 50 more to find, but they say none of the 887 known NEOs are a serious threat to our planet.

Auggie decides to go to school, but he is very nervous on his first day. Like any child starting a new school, he feels anxious. However, because of his appearance, it is even harder for him. Other kids do not want to sit with him, and he sees them staring or whispering about him. Luckily, he makes friends with Jack, a boy in his class, and Summer, a girl he talks to at lunch. But the first day is not the only challenge. Auggie finds out that his classmates are afraid to touch him, thinking they might catch something. Throughout the school year, Auggie experiences many ups and downs, and then a surprising and difficult event at a school camp changes everything.

The two men looked towards the northern part of the land. It went on as far as they could see. The fences were hard to see from where they were standing. Even if a bored and rebellious teenage boy wanted to escape, he couldn't do it on foot. Sam looked at the biggest horse, which was kicking the ground with its strong hooves. He wondered if the boy could ride. A good rider could find a lot of trouble out here, far from anyone. But someone who didn’t know anything about horses and wanted to run away from his father might get into even more trouble.

More than 4,000 climbers, aged from thirteen to eighty, have reached the top of Everest. Climbing high mountains in cold weather and strong storms is still very dangerous, but the best climbers are now looking for new challenges. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner from Austria started to love mountain climbing when she was a teenager. After finishing school, she worked as a nurse but continued to climb in her free time.

After climbing Everest, Gerlinde chose to climb all fourteen of the world's mountains that are 8,000 meters high. To make it more challenging, she climbs without using oxygen tanks. This is dangerous because low oxygen at the top of high mountains can harm the brain and body. Gerlinde also uses her fame as a climber to help a charity for poor children and orphans in Nepal.

If we look at the things we have bought in our lives, we can see that not everything is used well. For example, we might have a thick wool coat that we thought was stylish, even though we live in a hot country. We might have a smartphone that we stopped using when we got a new one. We may have a car that we only drive on weekends, or a guest room in our house that has become a storage room.

Throughout history and in different cultures, dreams have been linked to prophecy. People believed that dreams were messages from the gods, meant to give us knowledge or understanding. Even today, many people remember a time when they dreamed about something, like an event, place, or person, and later that dream came true in real life.

Some of the largest and most costly transportation projects in the world are about building bridges. Bridges are important connections that allow cars, trucks, and trains to cross rivers, deep valleys, or other roads. Because of this, they are a key part of civil engineering and are closely watched, especially when they fall down.

After weeks of feeling frustrated, Gabriela emailed her Swedish manager about the problems she was having with her team. Her manager asked her if she thought her team was still doing well and what could help her work better with her team members. Gabriela thought her manager was unclear and did not feel he was handling the situation well.

Dogs that live in groups have learned that humans often give food to smaller, cuter dogs. So, these smaller dogs are sent to ask for food for the whole group. Some dogs have even figured out how to use the metro system to move around their area! Scientists are not sure how the dogs know when to get off the train. One idea is that they use their strong sense of smell to recognize the scents of places they like. Another idea is that they can understand the names of stations from the announcements. Now, metro passengers are so used to seeing dogs on the trains that they often don’t notice them.

Ed Stafford from the UK is the first person to walk the whole length of the Amazon River. He began at a small stream in the Andes mountains of Peru and reached the river's mouth in Brazil after two years and four months, walking 6,000 kilometers. The Amazon rainforest has dangerous animals like poisonous snakes, crocodiles, and jaguars, so Ed faced many dangers. Fortunately, he only got a few thousand bites from mosquitoes and ants.

In Britain, the average person spends over £1,000 on new clothes each year, which is about four percent of their income. This may not seem like a lot, but it shows two bigger problems for society and the environment. First, many people are using credit cards to pay for these clothes. Right now, British adults owe about £670 each to credit card companies. This is 66 percent of what they spend on clothes. Also, people are spending money they don’t have to buy things they don’t need. Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothing every year, and most of it ends up in landfills.

Ed's walk would not have been possible without technology. He used a radio to ask the people in the rainforest for food and to cross their land. Many of them came to meet him and helped him through the tough areas. While he walked, Ed wrote a blog about his daily experiences. He used the media's interest in his trip to speak out against the destruction of the rainforest and to raise money for environmental and children's charities in Brazil and Peru.

Businesses have realized that they can make money from the sharing economy by using resources that are not fully used. A popular business model now is for companies to create online platforms that connect customers with people who offer specific products or services. For example, Airbnb helps people rent out their empty rooms and houses for extra income. Another example is Uber, which allows people to use their own cars as taxis to earn some extra money in their free time.

One important job of modern zoos is to help with breeding programs for endangered animals. In the wild, some rare animals have trouble finding mates and having babies. They also face dangers from poachers, losing their homes, and other animals that hunt them. A good zoo allows these animals to live and breed safely. As the number of some wild animals decreases, there is a risk that they become too similar genetically. Breeding programs help by allowing zoo-bred animals to be released into the wild, which increases genetic diversity.

Both types of accidents are very rare, but boats and trains can cause a bridge to fall for different reasons. For trains, it's the speed of the impact that can make a bridge collapse. For boats, it's their heavy weight that can cause the collapse, even if they are moving slowly. The best way to prevent bridge failures is to plan ahead. New technologies that can find weak spots, safer work areas, and better designs can all help reduce these serious accidents.

At first, Pi is very scared of the animals and jumps into the ocean. Then he remembers there are hungry sharks in the water and realizes he must climb back into the lifeboat. One by one, the animals in the lifeboat kill and eat each other, until only Pi and a tiger are left. Luckily for Pi, the tiger, whom he names Richard Parker, is seasick and does not want to eat him right away.

When Pi is 16, a new government is elected that his parents do not like. They are worried about the future, so they decide to close the zoo and move to Canada. Some animals are sold to zoos in North America, and the family travels by ship to Canada with the animals. During the journey, a terrible storm happens, and the ship sinks. Sadly, Pi's family and the sailors drown, but Pi ends up in a lifeboat with a hyena, a zebra, an orangutan, and a big tiger.

The Hunger Games is a very popular book for teenagers and young adults written by American author Suzanne Collins. Since it came out in 2008, it has been translated into 26 languages and has sold millions of copies worldwide. It was also the first book for young readers to sell over a million electronic copies. The Hunger Games is now a big Hollywood movie and is just as successful, making 152.5 million dollars in its first weekend in North America!

Dreams might happen because our mind is sorting out the thoughts we have during the day, but they show up in dreams with special meanings. When we are awake, we usually think in words, like talking to ourselves. However, when we sleep, the part of our brain that helps us use language is less active, while the part that deals with emotions is more active.

Having good relationships is very important for happiness. In one study, most happy people had strong connections with friends and family and spent time with them often. You also need at least one person to share your personal feelings with, which is called 'self-disclosure'. Just one close friend for deep conversations is enough, along with other relationships. It’s not enough to have many friends just to hang out or talk about music or football. That deeper connection is very important. Some people need to learn how to listen better to build stronger relationships.

Psychologist Carol Dweck, who supports the idea of a 'growth mindset', talked about how our brains can change and how we can improve skills and talents that we may not have been good at before. Many people often praise the final results and natural talents, like saying, "You have a great eye for details" or "You are really good at organizing events." However, research shows that if we focus on the process of doing things—like praising effort, trying new things, and solving problems—we can help people develop new skills and improve their talents.

The rover checks the air around it from time to time, and in 2014 it discovered that the air had methane, which is a simple organic molecule and an important part of natural gas. Methane only lasts for a few hundred years, so something on Mars must be making more of it. NASA says that Mars releases thousands of tons of methane at once. The amount of methane goes up and down with the seasons, almost like the planet is breathing.

Early in her career, psychologist Carol Dweck from Stanford University gave some ten-year-olds problems that were a bit too difficult for them. One group reacted well; they said they loved challenges and believed they could improve their skills. Dweck calls this a 'growth mindset' because they focus on what they can achieve in the future. However, another group of children felt their intelligence was being judged and thought they had failed. They had a 'fixed mindset' and could not see how they could get better. Some of these children said they might cheat later, while others looked for someone who did worse than them to feel better about themselves.

Horror films often take place in empty places. This could be an abandoned hospital, a creepy empty house, or a ghost town. There is something interesting about these lonely places. What was it like when people lived there? Why did they leave? The silence can also be very scary. Abandoned places are useful for horror film directors because it makes sense that there is no phone signal there.

No matter what type of house it is, the basement is a scary place in horror movies. It's often where something is hiding or where the bad person keeps their tools. Basements are usually dark and wet. You can only get to them by a narrow staircase. They always feel creepy, even when there is nothing there.

Gary Collins, a policeman on holiday, was watching the London riots on TV. He saw some people he knew and decided to cut his holiday short to help identify them. He spent six months looking at CCTV footage and identified 190 people, often just by their eyes. His help was very important for the investigation. Even though there were 200,000 hours of video, facial recognition software only identified one person.

I find it interesting to think about how we can make our evolution faster by improving our bodies. Imagine if we could put a computer in our brain! Soon, we will be able to do this and improve our math skills, how we see and hear, and our memory. This idea will become more common in the future.

It was an interesting talk, and the speaker made some great points. For example, she talked about how parents influence their children. How can we expect teenagers not to text while doing homework if they see their parents using social media while cooking or waiting at a red light? She also mentioned how people want to be in many places at once, so they switch between real-life and online conversations. I notice this a lot with my teenage daughter and her friends. They meet up but often sit in silence, each talking to someone else online.

While news stories often make us think the world is getting more violent, there is also some good news. From the end of World War II to 1990, there were 30 wars that killed over 100,000 people. Today, there are still civil wars, but most countries are living together more peacefully than before. However, terrorism has increased in recent years, and since World War II, more civilians have died in wars than soldiers. On a positive note, even for civilians, the numbers are not all bad. Although violent crime is nine times more likely to cause deaths than political conflict, the global murder rate has slightly decreased, from 8 per 100,000 people in 2000 to about 5.3 in 2015.

Wasfia has spent her life helping human rights and has seen many projects in her country that teach women and girls. However, when these projects end, the women are often left with nothing. Wasfia realized that Bangladesh needed to be stronger, so she combined her love for climbing and human rights to change how people think about women in her country. She started climbing while working on humanitarian projects in Tibet and Nepal, since most people in flat Bangladesh have never seen a mountain. Her campaign is working, as people in her country and around the world are starting to pay attention.

Many people think that developing countries are in a very bad situation, facing extreme poverty, ruled by dictators, and having little chance for change. However, this is not true. In fact, a big change is happening. In the last 20 years, more than 700 million people have raised their income and escaped poverty. Also, six million fewer children die each year from diseases, more girls are going to school, and many more people have clean water.

Many managers try to make their feedback more positive by placing negative comments between two positive ones. However, if this becomes a habit, employees may start to see positive comments as just a way to soften the negative ones, which makes them less meaningful. Positive feedback should not just be used to soften the negative; it should be given to support and encourage good work.

I am part of the Campaign to Stop Killer Robots. Forget the scary image of a Terminator from movies. Right now, military machines like drones and robots are already being used to kill with little human control. The next step could be robots that decide who to kill by themselves. I believe this would be very wrong and dangerous for people. We need to be very careful about what we let machines do.

More people are learning English than all other languages together, and English is spoken in the most countries. However, Chinese has the most native speakers. There is not much connection between the number of native speakers of a language and the number of learners. But there is a stronger connection between the number of learners and how many countries have speakers of that language.

Your manager stops you and says she wants to talk about your work on the recent project. You feel worried all weekend, thinking about what you might have done wrong. When you go into her office on Monday morning, she starts by complimenting you on the good work you did. You wonder if this is just the usual nice comment before the real feedback. You know how the feedback sandwich works: say something nice, give the real feedback, and then say something nice again.
